meanings.definition: To release from discharge before the usual or proper time.
meanings.sent1: The hospital predischarges patients who have recovered quickly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor predischarges the patient to free up the hospital bed.
meanings.sent3: The nurse predischarges the teddy bear from the pretend hospital too soon.
meanings.sent4: The teacher predischarges the students into the weekend, eager for a break.
meanings.sent5: The sun predischarges its rays over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: The act of releasing from discharge before the usual or proper time.
meanings.sent1: The predischarges of patients can sometimes lead to readmission.
meanings.sent2: The hospital's predischarges have increased due to improved recovery methods.
meanings.sent3: The early predischarges from work on Fridays make everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: The predischarges of students from school early caused chaos in the hallways.
meanings.sent5: The predischarges of balloons at the party added to the festive atmosphere.
